raw_text: The OVIS annotations are in contrast with other corpora and systems (e.g. Miller et al. 1996), in that our annotation convention exploits the Principle of Compositionality of Meaning
clean_text: The OVIS annotations are in contrast with other corpora and systems (e.g. Miller et al. 1996), in that our annotation convention exploits the Principle of Compositionality of Meaning.

raw_text: This use of model-theoretic interpretation represents an important extension to the`semantic grammars ' used in existing statistical spoken language interfaces, which rely on co-occurrences among lexically-determined semantic classes and slot llers (Miller et al, 1996), in that the probability of an analysis is now also conditioned on the existence of denoted entities and relations in the world model
clean_text: This use of model-theoretic interpretation represents an important extension to thesemantic grammars used in existing statistical spoken language interfaces, which rely on co-occurrences among lexically-determined semantic classes and slot fillers (Miller et al, 1996), in that the probability of an analysis is now also conditioned on the existence of denoted entities and relations in the world model.

raw_text: Examples include an early statistical method for learning to fill slot-value representations (Milleret al, 1996) and a more recent approach for recovering semantic parse trees (Ge& amp; Mooney, 2006)

raw_text: Since all PPs are attached at the same level, at codon 12 and in duodenal lavage fluid are sisters, and so there is no constituent consisting of just point mutations at codon 12.Casting the variation event as a relation between different component entities allows the component entities to correspond to tree constituents, while retaining the capacity to annotate and search for more complex events. raw_text: We are only aware of one system that learns to construct context-dependent interpretations (Miller et al, 1996)

raw_text: The Miller et al (1996) approach is fully supervised and produces a final meaning representation in SQL
clean_text: The Miller et al (1996) approach is fully supervised and produces a final meaning representation in SQL.

raw_text: Evaluation Metrics Miller et al (1996) report accuracy rates for recovering correct SQL annotations on the test set
clean_text: Evaluation Metrics Miller et al (1996) report accuracy rates for recovering correct SQL annotations on the test set.

raw_text: In the domain of the Air Traveler Information System (Miller et al, 1996) the authors apply statistical methods to compute the probability that a constituent can fill in a semantic slot within a semantic frame
clean_text: In the domain of the Air Traveler Information System (Miller et al, 1996) the authors apply statistical methods to compute the probability that a constituent can fill in a semantic slot within a semantic frame.

raw_text: For example, in the context of the Air Traveler Information System (ATIS) for spoken dialogue, Miller et al (1996) computed the probability that a constituent such as Atlanta& quot ;lled a semantic slot such as Destination in a semantic frame for air travel
clean_text: For example, in the context of the Air Traveler Information System (ATIS) for spoken dialogue, Miller et al (1996) computed the probability that a constituent such as Atlanta filled a semantic slot such as Destination in a semantic frame for air travel.
